ray.camera

Class Camera

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.camera.Camera

  • public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a simple camera. The camera has a position in space, location, and a frame, described by back, up, and right. The frame determines how the camera is oriented relative to space. The view of the camera is described by fields of view in each dimension (the size of the angle the camera can see). Typical values are 45-60 degrees, Typically, regardless of the shape of the image, points on the camera plane are described at lying in the square [0,1]x[0,1]. The user generally maps points in the image to camera plane coordinates before making queries of the camera.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Vector3 back
      The direction opposite the direction that the camera is looking.
      protected Point3 location
      The location of the camera in the scene.
      protected Vector3 right
      The right vector of the camera, it points toward the right side of the image.
      protected Vector3 up
      The up vector of the camera, it points toward the top of the image.
      protected double xFOV
      The full horizontal field of view in degrees.
      protected double yFOV
      The full vertical field of view in degrees.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Camera

        public Camera()
        Default constructor, assumes camera uses the default values.

      • Camera

        public Camera(Point3 eye,
              Point3 target,
              Vector3 up,
              double inXFOV,
              double inYFOV)
        Camera constructor. It is difficult to input the 4 camera position and orientation components in their raw form. What is much more common is to enter two points and a vector, generally called the eye, target and up respectively. The eye is the position of the camera. The target is the point the camera will "look" at. Finally, the up vector defines the vertical direction in the image. An orthonormal basis is contructed from these vectors to describe the camera orientation.
        Parameters:
        eye - the camera eye point
        target - the camera target point
        up - the camera up vector
        inXFOV - the new vertical field of view in radians
        inYFOV - the new horizontal field of view in radians

      • lookAt

        public void lookAt(Point3 inEye,
                   Point3 inTarget,
                   Vector3 inUp)
        Sets the camera to look at target from eye and have an up direction up.
        Parameters:
        inEye - the new location of the camera
        inTarget - the new target of the camera
        inUp - the new up direction of the camera

      • getRay

        public void getRay(Ray outRay,
                   double inU,
                   double inV)
        Set outRay to be a ray from the camera through the point in the image (xPixel, yPixel). The direction of outRay is normalized after this call.
        Parameters:
        outRay - The output ray
        inU - The u coord of the image point
        inV - The v coord of the image point

      • setEye

        public void setEye(Point3 cacheEye)
        Deprecated. 
        Used internally by the parser to set the original value of the camera. Use lookAt instead.
        Parameters:
        cacheEye - The cacheEye to set.
